@totemtang The difference between these two versions of UpdateValue is that the second version doesn't allocate, while the first does one allocation. (you can use the '-benchmem' flag to see allocations and use '-memprofile <file>' to create a profile of your allocations. [see here for more information](http://blog.golang.org/profiling-go-programs). you can also use '-gcflags -S' to see the assembly generated by the compiler)

**Update:** See [this gist](https://gist.github.com/nuss-justin/2a4996fc19f6e2bcc744) for a small example of this allocation.
